answerText: constraints[10] The forces of a holonomic constraint don't do any "virtual" this. This word normally refers to a quantity equal to force times distance and measured in joules.
heading: ACF Regionals  |2012 | South Carolina and Carlton | 17 | Science | Physics | College
subject: Science
question: Question: Holonomic examples of these are ones that can be written as a function of the coordinates set equal to zero.  [10]  Name these relations that limit the behavior of a physical system.
